lines.text: [Max sees that 'Agent Hargraves' is the old blind woman who killed him after he refused to help her cross the street]
That's entrapment! It's not fair!
Fair? Are you forgetting where you are?

[referring to Toby's sudden hostility]
Some swell marriage we're gonna have! If he hates me, he'll be impossible to live with.
You don't have to worry about that. The slightest hint to Agent Hargraves and it's all over. You gonna synchronize your watch?
They all signed. I'm free! Aren't I?
Yes, you are, but by midnight, they belong to me.
Not until the natural end of their lives. That's what you said.
I lied. I need them now.
Oh, no! Barney, please! I couldn't have done it if I'd known that! He's a great kid. They're all great kids, but that kid, kill him and you kill her!
Unfortunately, her soul does not belong to me. You win some, you lose some. But then again, you have your precious life.
[from trailer]
Want a light?
Oh my God!
I wish you wouldn't say that.
I'm sorry!
Yeah.
What happens to the kids after they sign?
Nothing. We don't get them until the natural ends of their lives.
The air conditioning's on the fritz and it's hotter than Hell up here!

[to Max]
Ha! He doesn't know how hot it is.
What about my contracts?
So that's what this is all about?
Yes. My associates are getting a little itchy.

I don't care! I got until midnight, May 15th. That's our deal. Look, I'm... I'm telling you. I'm trying to get these people so hooked on me, they'll sign anything. That takes time. Now, if I go too fast, I'm liable to blow the whole deal!
I like your style, Max. You're a devious fellow.
You want me to corrupt the souls of little kids? See, I've never been much on kids... but that's not a nice thing.
Neither is Level 4.
Where do I sign?
You harboring some kind of death wish, Max?
No, but you are! You're lucky you're dead, man, or so help me you would be!
You're getting angry, Max.
You're darn right, I am! Don't you ever, ever try a stunt like that on me again!
Just trying to get your attention.
Well, next time try tapping me on the shoulder.

[Max runs into the living room and lights up the fire place in an attempt to burn the three signed contracts]
I know you're here! Let me see your rotten, lying, deceitful face now! I'm gonna burn your contracts!

[the next scene is in Hell where Barney, first in voice-over during the first three words, is now in full "devil" makeup]
Burn those contracts and eternal damnation is yours! You'll know the unmitigating pain and horror of limbs being torn from their sockets! Your limbs! Your sockets! You'll feel pain you've never imagined in life! Yours, forever! Flesh, you'll smell burning! Your flesh! Rotting! Forever!
You'll never get these kids! Never!
[Max throws the contracts into the fire while saying "Never" the second time]
[Barney materializes to Max in the car's passenger seat while Max is driving]
Mind if I join you?
What are you doing here?
I've never been to the Grammys.
Be my guest.
Goody for me. Goody for you too. Congratulations on your engagement. When's the happy day?
This Saturday, sandwiched in between the first and second motos and after that, Stella's concert at the music center.
Well, it's gonna be very busy. The 15th? You're cutting it a little close, aren't you?
I had no choice in the matter. It was her decision.
Well, at least you'll have saved yourself.
Yeah.
You don't look too happy about it.
Nobody said I had to enjoy it.
Beats Level 4, but your hair looks nice.
Thank you.
Listen, a weird thing... a weird thing just happened, there's this mirror behind the cashier...
You're one of us now. Inhabitants of Hell cast no reflection.
[last lines]

[Max looks up toward Heaven and mouths]
Thank you very much.

[Max goes after blind lady after Nerve tells him that she tripped him before his motorbike started up]
Who are you?

[She takes off her sunglasses]
We have them here too, you know.
We? Where do you come from?

[She looks up, indicating Heaven, then looks back at Max]
You're not gonna take him away now, are you, your holiness?

[She chuckles]
Oh, no. He's much too young to die.
[She leaves Max, putting her sunglasses back on]

[Max says to himself]
So am I!
I love you, Max.

How could you possibly love ME? I'm not lovable. I'm not even nice. I'm irresponsible. Unreliable. You've said so yourself a million times. Look, even if we try, I'll still probably leave you without any warning. I'm a rotten person.
The only trouble with you, Max, is that you have no self-image.
You noticed?

[Max turns away from Penny and faces the mirror]
Oh, my God.
[He sees his reflection]
I don't believe it.
What is it, Max? What's wrong?
It's ME! I don't believe it. It's me in the mirror. I... I don't believe it.
[He moves closer and closer to the mirror. Penny follows]
I won. I WON. I WON!
Won what?
I beat that lousy, rotten, slimy, no-good, son-of-a...
Beat who? Beat who?

[He turns to face Penny and hold her shoulders]
Barney! I beat Barney! He had my soul!
Are you all right, Max?
All right?
[He kisses Penny on the cheek]
I've never been more all right in my life!
[He turns back to the mirror]
Hello! That's the most amazing sight I've ever seen!
You're talking crazy, Max?

[He runs to the couch and starts walking on it while talking to Penny]
No, no, I know it's crazy. I know, I know, I know it sounds crazy! I know that, but it's so basic. It's just so simple. It's like it's good and bad and-and Heaven and Hell and God and the Devil! Penny, look, all my life, I made wrong choices. I made wrong choices!
[He gets off the couch and walks over to Penny]
But this time, I made the right choice and the Devil lost my soul! He LOST me!
I'm gonna call the doctor.
It was a long, hard pull, man, and I got nobody to thank but myself.
[Stella and Barney walk off with the audience murmuring then applauding]

[Max speaks to Jerry]
My God! She's a monster!

[Barney is sitting right behind and between Max and Jerry]
She's fabulous, sweetheart. That's just the way we like 'em. One down, two to go.
I can't believe it! After all, we've meant to each other, you would actually evict me for keeping a parakeet in my room?
Sweetheart, if I let you keep a parakeet, I'd have to let everybody else keep a parakeet and this is not a bird sanctuary, it's an apartment house!
Honey, he's only following rules. If you want to blame someone, blame the rotten owner!
He IS the rotten owner!

[Max is giving Nerve a few pointers as to how to win the upcoming race]
It's very simple. You start. You ride like a bat out of Hell and you win.

[Barney shows up behind Nerve]
Have you ever seen one of our bats?
Uh? Scratch that. You start... and you win.

[Max sees Barney at his wedding, standing next to the Maid of Honor]
Who invited you?
I'm the Maid of Honor.
These are trivial misdemeanors.
I'm aware of that. This is a new game plan, remember?

[the phone is ringing and Toby goes into the house to answer it]
Hello?
Hello, Toby? This is your Uncle Max.

[His voice is heard over the phone]
Oh, hi!
Can I talk to your mother, please?
Uh? Just a sec, all right?
[He goes outside while holding the phone and talks to his mother, who's sitting at a table with a few kids]
It's for you, Mom. It's Uncle Max.
Uncle Max. I don't believe it. Tell him that I'm uh...
[She then says quietly]
Tell him that I'm not here.

[He goes back on the phone with Max]
She says to say she's not here.
Huh? Well, then, you tell her it's somebody else. I have to talk to her.

[Toby gets off the phone to talk to his mother, Penny]
He says to say he's someone else.
Excuse me, you guys.

[She gets up from the table and walks over to Toby, who hands over the phone. She goes inside the house with Toby following. During the phone conversation, she sees Toby trying to leave and she stops him]
Hello. Uncle Max? Uh, I don't know who you are or what you want, but I want you to leave me and my son alone, please?

[Between four and five seconds, Max's voice is heard over the phone. Then, the camera's right on him and zooms in]
Mrs. Hart, don't hang up on me, please, until you hear me out, okay? You may think this sounds insane, but I've fallen deeply in love...
[She hangs up]

[She speaks to Toby]
You know what you are? You are the only 11-year-old procurer in the business.
What's a...
Forget it.
[She goes back outside with Toby following]
So between managing the Nordlinger boy and Stella, I'm perpetually on the run, as you can imagine.
I don't have to imagine. I can tell by looking at you. Don't you ever look in the mirror when you shave?
[She's alluding to the fact that there are paper-covered cuts all over his face]
Not if I can help it.

Believe me, Penny. My life isn't my own. And on top of everything else, there's my real estate responsibilities, which are considerable. Some landlords will allow a place to go to Hell in a trash can, but not me. Constant repairs, constant maintenance, constant outlays of time and money.
I'll bet.

And then there's the little old ladies who insists on keeping their pets and the young, married couples who insists on keeping their kids. Not that I've got anything against kids, but some landlords feel it's rough enough taking care of a place these days without them. Thumping and bumping around. And playing handball on your walls at all hours and putting their mangy, little hands on your fresh paint. Plus, the whining and the wailing all night! And at the crack of dawn in the morning, before you've had your coffee, they'll ring your bell with the most insipid, stupid questions that you never have an answer to! It can drive you nuts!
Is that how you really feel about kids?
Well... sometimes.
Me too, sometimes.
